title: Migrants on Foot Make Last Dash Into Canada Before Rules Tighten
description: A freer era of migration into Canada ended on Saturday when officials stopped accepting asylum petitions from people who walk in at unofficial crossings.

title: Israel’s Defense Minister Says Government Should Halt Contentious Judicial Plan
description: Yoav Gallant, who oversees Israel’s military, is the first minister in Benjamin Netanyahu’s government to criticize a plan to weaken the judiciary. His comments follow fears that weeks of unrest have undermined military capacity.

title: Illegal Mining Fuels Crisis For Indigenous Tribe in Brazil’s Amazon
description: Illegal mines have fueled a humanitarian crisis for the Yanomami Indigenous group. Brazil’s new president is trying to fight back.

title: Illegal Mining Fuels Crisis For Indigenous Tribe in Brazil’s Amazon
description: Illegal mines have fueled a humanitarian crisis for the Yanomami Indigenous group. Brazil’s new president is trying to fight back.

title: Pope Increases Lay Leaders’ Responsibility in Sexual Abuse Law
description: The most significant part of the law, a permanent version of a 2019 measure, may be its impact on the “lay faithful,” who will be more accountable for abuse.

title: ‘Merchant of Landscapes’: The Lasting Footprint of a Japanese Gardener in Mexico
description: Every spring, Jacarandas bloom in Mexico City, the colorful purple flowers a living legacy of a Japanese gardener.

title: ‘Succession’ Returns
description: The last season premieres tomorrow. Let the weeping and gnashing of teeth commence.

title: 200,000-Dollar Fine Aims to Expose Money Laundering in Canada
description: In a new bid to end the use of shell companies to hide crimes and avoid taxes, the federal government will require clear records of corporate ownership. Will provincial governments follow?

title: An Anxious Asia Arms for a War It Hopes to Prevent
description: Doubts about both China and the United States are driving an arms race in the Indo-Pacific with echoes of World War II and new levels of risk.

title: Who Will Take Care of Italy’s Older People? Robots, Maybe.
description: The Western world’s oldest population is facing a crisis of caregivers. Some are looking for a little helping, plastic, hand.

title: Thousands of Ukrainians Endure Dire Conditions Around Bakhmut, Aid Groups Say
description: The fighting for the city has been the most violent of recent months and does not appear to be letting up.

title: Paul Rusesabagina, ‘Hotel Rwanda’ Hero, Freed From Prison
description: Paul Rusesabagina, a critic of Rwanda’s president, was tricked into entering the country, then sentenced to 25 years after what his supporters called a show trial.

title: The U.S. Volunteers in Ukraine Who Lie, Waste and Bicker
description: People who would not be allowed anywhere near the battlefield in a U.S.-led war are active on the Ukrainian front, with ready access to American weaponry.
